election_record.label: New York 1810 Lieutenant Governor

overview.note: John Broome received 171 votes as John Brome, 55 votes as John Broon, 15 votes as John Brom, 8 votes as John Broone, 2 votes as John Bloom and 1 vote each as John Beoon, John Bloam, John Blom, John Boon, John Boon, John Boom, John Browem and Johh Broom.
Nicholas Fish received 28 votes as Nicholas, 1 vote as Nicholas Fist, 1 vote as Nicholas Fitch and 1 vote as Nicholas Fusk.
James W. Wilkins received 1 vote as James W. Wilkin.
James W. Wilkins, Reuben Neely, Nathan Smith and Daniel D. Tompkins were candidates for other offices.
Reuben Sands was an amalgamation of two candidates for State Senate: Robert Sands and Reuben Neely.

sub_unit.name: Eastern
sub_unit.note: The New-York Evening Post (New York, NY) of June 21 lists John Broome with 9948 total votes

sub_unit.name: Albany
sub_unit.note: The Albany Register (Albany, NY) lists John Broome with 1110 votes.

The Official Canvass did not report any misspelling votes in Albany County for Lieutenant Governor. Town Election Returns however, did report Ten [10] votes for John Broom, which the county election officials decided to include in the votes for John Broome. Please note: increasingly many of the obvious misspelling votes reported in the Town Election Returns were being included in the Official Canvass results. This indicates that some election officials were becoming aware of, or taking into consideration, voter intent.

sub_unit.name: Watervliet
sub_unit.note: The Albany Register (Albany, NY) lists John Broome with 46 votes.

sub_unit.name: Franklin
sub_unit.note: John Broome received 8 votes as John Broone.

sub_unit.name: Montgomery
sub_unit.note: The Columbian (New York, NY) lists John Broome with 1886 votes.

sub_unit.name: Lansingburgh
sub_unit.note: The Columbian (New York, NY) of May 18 lists the votes for Lansignburgh and Troy in reverse order compared to other sources.

sub_unit.name: Nassau
sub_unit.note: The Albany Register (Albany, NY) of May 11 lists John Broome with 76 votes, but lists the same total votes as other sources do for the county.

sub_unit.name: Troy
sub_unit.note: The Albany Register (Albany, NY) of May 11 lists Nicholas Fish with 206 votes, but lists the same total votes as other sources do for the county.
The Columbian (New York, NY) of May 18 lists the votes for Lansignburgh and Troy in reverse order compared to other sources.

sub_unit.name: Saratoga
sub_unit.note: John Broome received 171 votes as John Brome.
The Independent American (Ballston Spa, NY) lists Nicholas Fish with 1394 votes.

sub_unit.name: Galway
sub_unit.note: The Saratoga Advertiser (Ballston Spa, NY) of May 8 lists John Broome with 18 (or 18[blank]) votes indicating that a digit was left off, but gives the same total votes for the county as other sources do.

sub_unit.name: Moreau
sub_unit.note: The Independent American (Ballston Spa, NY) lists Nicholas Fish with 29 votes.

sub_unit.name: Northumberland
sub_unit.note: The Saratoga Advertiser (Ballston Spa, NY) of May 8 lists John Broome without any votes, but lists the same total votes for the county as other sources do..

sub_unit.name: Schenectady
sub_unit.note: The Albany Register (Albany, NY) of May 8, American Citizen (New York, NY) of May 14, The Columbian (New York, NY) of May 11, The Columbian. (For the Country) (New York, NY) of May 11, and Western Budget (Schenectady, NY) of May 1 all list John Broome with 537 total votes and Nicholas Fish with 488 total votes, which is the sum of the town and ward totals in this county listed in these sources.
The Albany Register (Albany, NY) of June 19 and the Balance and New York State Journal of June 22 list John Broome with 489 total votes for Schenectady County and do not list votes by town or ward.

sub_unit.name: Washington
sub_unit.note: The Northern Post (Salem, NY) lists John Broome with 2294 votes and Nicholas Fish with 1778 votes but these are either typesetting or addition errors as the town totals are the same.

sub_unit.name: Middle
sub_unit.note: The New-York Evening Post (New York, NY) of June 21 lists John Broome with 9319 total votes and Nicholas Fish with 7683 total votes.

The Albany Register (Albany, NY) of June 19 and the Balance of New York State Journal of June 22 list John Broome with 9326 total votes for the district, but the sum of the county totals, when county totals are based on town totals, equal 9246 for the district.

sub_unit.name: Columbia
sub_unit.note: The Albany Register (Albany, NY) of May 8, American Citizen (New York, NY) of May 10, The Columbian (New York, NY) of May 10, and Northern Whig (Hudson, NY) list John Broome with 1595 total votes and Nicholas Fish with 2153 total votes.
The Albany Register (Albany, NY) of June 19 and the Balance of New York State Journal of June 22 list John Broome with 1574 total votes for the county, but the sum of the town totals is 1594.
The American Citizen (New York, NY) of May 10 and the Northern Whig (Hudson, NY) list John Broome as John Broom.

sub_unit.name: Canaan
sub_unit.note: The Albany Register (Albany, NY) of May 8, American Citizen (New York, NY) of May 10, The Columbian (New York, NY) of May 10, and Northern Whig (Hudson, NY) list John Broome with 282 votes.

sub_unit.name: Chatham
sub_unit.note: John Broome received 1 vote as John Bloam.

sub_unit.name: Claverack
sub_unit.note: The Albany Register (Albany, NY) of May 8, American Citizen (New York, NY) of May 10, The Columbian (New York, NY) of May 10, and Northern Whig (Hudson, NY) list John Broome with 298 votes and Nicholas Fish with 281 votes.

sub_unit.name: Hillsdale
sub_unit.note: Nicholas Fish received 1 vote as Nicholas Fitch.

sub_unit.name: Kinderhook
sub_unit.note: The Albany Register (Albany, NY) of May 8, American Citizen (New York, NY) of May 10, The Columbian (New York, NY) of May 10, and Northern Whig (Hudson, NY) list John Broome with 136 votes.

sub_unit.name: Delaware
sub_unit.note: James W. Wilkins received 1 vote as James W. Wilkin.

sub_unit.name: Hancock
sub_unit.note: The Plebeian (Kingston of June 12 lists Nicholas Fish with 13 votes.

sub_unit.name: Dutchess
sub_unit.note: The Political Barometer lists John Broome with 1921 votes and Nicholas Fish with 2083 votes.

sub_unit.name: Orange
sub_unit.note: John Broome received 3 votes as John Broon, 2 votes as John Bloom and 1 vote as Johh Broom.

sub_unit.name: Sullivan
sub_unit.note: The American Citizen (New York, NY) of May 14, The Columbian (New York, NY) of May 11 and the Plebeian (Kingston, NY) of May 8 all list the totals by town as listed here and the sum of which for Nicholas Fish is 196 total votes. These sources, however, combine the town totals of Ulster and Sullivan County to 1516 total votes for John Broome and 1181 total votes for Nicholas and do not list the total votes for these two counties individually, while the actual sums based on the town totals they list equal 1516 and 1174 votes, respectively.

sub_unit.name: Ulster
sub_unit.note: The American Citizen (New York, NY) of May 14, The Columbian (New York, NY) of May 11 and the Plebeian (Kingston, NY) of May 8 all list the totals by town as listed here and the sum of which for John Broome is 1087 total votes and for Nicholas Fish is 978 total votes. These sources, however, combine the town totals of Ulster and Sullivan County to 1516 total votes for John Broome and 1181 total votes for Nicholas and do not list the total votes for these two counties individually, while the actual sums based on the town totals they list equal 1516 and 1174 votes, respectively.

sub_unit.name: Southern
sub_unit.note: The New-York Evening Post (New York, NY) of June 21 lists John Broome with 6042 total votes and Nicholas Fish with 4856 total votes.

sub_unit.name: Kings
sub_unit.note: "Majority for D. D. Thompkins [for Governor] 4. For Assembly, J.C. Vanderveer 8. For Lieutenant Governor and Senator the republican majority will not differ materially from the Governor's." The Long Island Star (Brooklyn, NY). May 3, 1810.

sub_unit.name: New York
sub_unit.note: The Columbian (New York, NY), New-York Spectator (New York, NY), American Citizen (New York, NY), New-York Evening Post (New York, NY), New-York Herald (New York, NY) and Commercial Advertiser list Nicholas Fish with 2130 votes. This includes the 338 votes in Ward 5.

sub_unit.name: Flushing
sub_unit.note: The votes from Flushing were rejected, as no office was designated.
The New York Journal and Public Advertiser (New York, NY), both from May 2, list John Broome with 75 votes and lists no votes for Nicholas Fish.
The American Citizen (New York, NY) of April 28 lists John Broome with 75 votes and Nicholas Fish with 65.

sub_unit.name: Oyster Bay
sub_unit.note: The New York Journal and Public Advertiser (new York), both from May 2, list John Broome with 172 votes.

sub_unit.name: Richmond
sub_unit.note: The New York Journal of May 5 lists John Broome with 251 votes.
The Public Advertiser of May 3 lists John Broome with 25 (or 25[blank]) indicating that a 1 was left off of the total votes.
The Columbian Gazette (Utica, NY) of May 15 lists John Broom with 154 total votes and does not give total votes by town.

sub_unit.name: Northfield
sub_unit.note: The New York Journal of May 5 and the Public Advertiser of May 3 list John Broome with 94 votes.

sub_unit.name: Westchester
sub_unit.note: Nicholas Fish received 1 vote as Nicholas Fist
John Broome received 11 votes as John Brom.

sub_unit.name: Western
sub_unit.note: The New-York Evening Post (New York, NY) of June 21 lists John Broome with 17473 total votes and Nicholas Fish with 14155 total votes.
The Albany Register (Albany, NY) of June 19 and the Balance and New York State Journal of June 22 list John Broome with 18334 total votes and Nicholas Fish with 17626 total votes.

sub_unit.name: Allegany
sub_unit.note: John Broome received 4 votes as John Brom.

sub_unit.name: Cortland
sub_unit.note: Nicholas Fish received 27 votes as Nicholas.

sub_unit.name: Herkimer
sub_unit.note: John Broome received 1 vote as John Blom.

sub_unit.name: German Flatts
sub_unit.note: The Bunker-Hill (Herkimer, NY) of May 10 and the American (Herkimer) of May 3 list Nicholas Fish with 56 votes.

sub_unit.name: Newport
sub_unit.note: The American (Herkimer, NY) of May 3 lists John Broome with 49 votes and Nicholas Fish with 39 votes.

sub_unit.name: Houndsfield
sub_unit.note: John Broome received 1 vote as John Broom.

sub_unit.name: Lewis
sub_unit.note: John Broome received 2 votes as John Broon.

sub_unit.name: Madison
sub_unit.note: Nicholas Fish received 1 vote as Nicholas.

sub_unit.name: Niagara
sub_unit.note: The Columbian Gazette (Utica, NY) lists John Broome with 533 votes and Nicholas Fish with 305 votes.

sub_unit.name: Oneida
sub_unit.note: The totals from Oneida County include the returns from Redfield, which were rejected as the totals were written in figures and not "in words at full length."
John Broome received 2 votes as John Broon.

sub_unit.name: Onondaga
sub_unit.note: John Broome received 1 vote as John Boon and 1 vote as John Boom.
Nicholas Fish receivd 1 vote as Nicholas Fusk.

The Columbian (New York, NY) of May 16, Pilot (Cazenovia) of May 9 and Columbian Gazette (Utica, NY) of May 8 all list John Broome with 1202 total votes (not likely including the 2 votes under alternate spellings).

sub_unit.name: Lysander
sub_unit.note: The votes from Lysander were rejected as the return was not regular and no certificate was annexed.

sub_unit.name: Lima
sub_unit.note: Eleven votes for Daniel D. Tompkins were not reported in the Official State Wide Canvass. The Original Town Certificate reads: "Daniel D. Tompkings and John Broome, eleven votes not designated on the face of them but endorsed on the back of each ticket for 'Governor.'"

sub_unit.name: Seneca
sub_unit.note: John Broome received 1 vote as John Browen.

sub_unit.name: Otsego
sub_unit.note: The totals from Otsego County include the votes from Butternuts, which were rejected as no office was designated.
John Broome received 48 votes as John Broon.
The Cooperstown Federalist (Cooperstown, NY) lists Nicholas Fish with 1650 votes, though the town totals add up to 1651.

sub_unit.name: Butternuts
sub_unit.note: The votes in Butternuts were rejected, no office having been designated.

sub_unit.name: New Lisbon
sub_unit.note: The Otsego Herald (Cooperstown, NY) lists John Broome with 59 votes.

sub_unit.name: Schoharie
sub_unit.note: The Albany Register (Albany, NY) and The Balance, and New-York State Journal (Albany, NY) list John Broome with 966 votes.

sub_unit.name: Ovid
sub_unit.note: The Geneva Gazette (Geneva, NY) of May 30 lists John Broome with 199 votes, but lists the same total votes for the county as other sources.

election_record.reference: Original Election Books. Steuben County Court House, Bath.
Miscellaneous Records of the Town of Eastchester New York, 1794-1834. 111-113.

The New York Journal (New York, NY). May 2, 1810.
The Long Island Star (Brooklyn, NY). May 3, 1810.

The Balance, and New-York State Journal (Albany, NY). June 22, 1810.
